title: Too much effort
body: I receive too many daily emails that require spending money to receive points.  When I try taking surveys, 90% of the time I am disqualified after just entering my demographics.  I don't understand why the survey was suggested to me if I am not going to match the demographics.  When I downloaded the Active Score Browser extension, it caused my laptop to run too slowly to be usable.  I have since removed the browser extension from my laptop.  It just so frustrating that it takes so much effort for so little reward.

title: Easy (but very slow) redemptions
body: I've been a MyPoints member for years. It's very easy to click through the email ads to get points, and it sets a cookie on your device so that if you go back to one of those sites later and do some shopping, you often will get credited with points as a result even if you weren't going out of your way to do so. I recently redeemed some of my points for a $100 Uber gift card so I could fund my Uber app and not worry about paying for rides for a bit. While I did expect to get my gift card immediately, or at least within 24 hours, that wasn't the case. It took a few days, which is a bummer. But the MyPoints site did warn me that it "might". I've redeemed points for other kinds of gift cards over the years and it's always taken several days to get my virtual redemption code in my email. But that's the only drawback.

title: Would be much better if you could actually get credited for your big ticket items that you bought through their website
body: Mypoints is a very good site. With many different ways in which to earn points. I have recommended it to many of my friends. The big downfall is that you don’t always get the points. I bought an hp laptop specifically through mypoints and points were never credited to my account. I wrote into mypoints contact team at least a dozen times and the times that I did receive a message in response..I was told that points could take weeks to appear. However it had Been past that. That’s it. No contact information even though I asked repeatedly for a number to call.  Every message I got told me to go back and contact them through the same form that I used every time before. I ended up giving up and No longer feel I can recommend the site.

title: MyPoints is easy to understand and use
body: MyPoints is easy to understand and use. There are several ways to get points that you can turn into gift cards. My favorite part of the site is the surveys. I have had a few surveys opportunities to make extra money on top of the original survey and they have paid very well. You also get points daily for the first few surveys that you get disqualified from. The very few times that I have needed support for something, they have always been respectful and quick to help me. They had taken points out of my account on accident but fixed the problem that same day. I was reimbursed within the hour. The site won't make you rich but it does make you extra money.

And now that videos are no longer playing, I am not able to make enough points to complete daily tasks. title: Have been a very long time member and…
body: Have been a very long time member and can attest that it is a legitimate website!  You answer various surveys, and various other activities, where you can earn points.  There is also a section where you can "shop" and you earn various points per dollar.  It takes 30 days for the "shop" points to get credited to your account.  I love MyPoints, but I will be honest there are times when there are glitches!  But hey, every website has glitches!  After you have a sufficient amount of points in your account, you can redeem the points for various gift cards!  It is very easy to do!  There is a vast array of stores or websites that are on the list!  I suggest you join MyPoints; I think you will like it!

title: Frustrating, annoying site
body: I've been a MyPoints member for many years, and it has consistently gone downhill.  For surveys, i'll complete many pages of detailed information, and then suddenly be "disqualified."  For Magic receipts, it rarely works properly, requiring a "review" of the receipt, and it's just not worth the hassle for 2-4 points. For purchases, so much time goes by before points are awarded that it's hard to keep track, and when I do try to follow up, it takes weeks of back and forth emails to actually get awarded the points I validly earned. For emails, the first 2 or 3 exchanges are totally useless, as they only send canned answers, and don't actually read what i've written to them.

title: One star since I can't put 0
body: One star only because it doesn't let me give none. Mypoints is a way to earn money, but customer service is non-existent. If you have a problem, they will block you from even sending tickets like they did to me. Surveys only pay pennies now. In April they reduced payouts for doing surveys in half. Now a 20 minute survey will pay 20 cents. They took away videos and coupons. Most of the deals on the page get your information, including email which they bombard with junk, but never credit. They run contest for points, but you have to spend money buying products and gift cards as well as give them points back to enter sweepstakes, to get any points. You can make pennies per hour on this site. They also have a "Magic receipt" where you upload receipts for points. Most sites, like Fetch can read your receipt and credit instantly. Mypoints system can't and many receipts that are instantly accepted on other sites and list the item you are trying to get credit for, will go under review for up to 4 days. You can earn points for shopping at different stores, but that doesn't always credit either. There are also a lot of exclusions for stores like Amazon and Walmart which most people shop most. I have almost never gotten points for any shopping on Amazon.

As a minister of a Non Profit Organization that helps disabled veterans and homeless communities all the proceeds get donated. So, not only did they steal from me but also everyone who benefits from the time and points earned on their site. A very underhanded, disrespectful, move that will eventually cost them a great deal more than what they stole.

title: Doing everything they can to insure you receive nothing in return for your time
body: For a month I attempted to rectify with mypoints a few hundred points that they did not award me for shopping through their portal. I've been a customer for over two decades. For this you receive nothing. Or—you qualify and you put in 15 minutes on the survey and it crashes and nothing works. When you try to get the points credited, they require you to provide the URL and the name of the survey and the precise number of points you were supposed to receive—as if you have any idea of what any of that is. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME.

title: Tried to get gift cards but don't have cell phone to verify
body: I tried to get electronic gift cards, but there was a verification process that involved having to have a cell phone or non-VOIP phone number.  I don't have a cell phone or non-VOIP phone number.  I contacted MyPoints May 28, 2022, about this.  The response was to wait for an email about getting verified.  I got that next email and followed instructions for downloading ID and had my face scanned.  I was told to then wait for another email--they said it could take a while.  After quite a while without hearing from anyone, I contacted MyPoints again; I then received an email for going through the verification process again (ID, face scan).  Then I got an email saying I can now get gift cards without the cell phone requirement.  I needed 3 cards in 3 different amounts; after getting the first 2 cards, it wouldn't let me get the 3rd because I was over the limit for the day.  IT DIDN"T SAY WHAT KIND OF LIMIT--maybe a dollar limit, maybe a number of cards limit?  The next day, I got the 3rd card.  Luckily, the place where I'd made the purchase May 30 let me use the gift cards today (8-3-2022 was when I got the 3rd card; I got the cards as soon as I could after getting word of being verified), and they took that amount off my credit card I used on May 30.  The item was a clearance item; if they hadn't let me wait to redeem gift cards and if I therefore waited to buy, I may have been out of luck for the reduced price even if the item was still in stock.  The last email from MyPoints saying they waived the verification process also said they may ask for verification in the future; I hope they don't ask for a cell phone number again!  I'm grateful things ended up O.K. and for MyPoints!

title: It's a mixed bag.
body: The gift cards come through once you earn them.  The problem with MyPoints is that the shopping points never credit without a hassle.  I have to do a ticket EVERY time I use the shop feature in order to get the points I earned with the purchase.  Then they want a screenshot of my order, delivery confirmation, etc. and it all has to be in jpeg or png formats.  That has not been easy for me to do, and requires a lot of recordkeeping.  It's a lot of hassle for just a little money.

What I don't like are the special bonus offers for donations, bank accounts, investments, etc, because they are never posted until you follow-up.  Point awards should be automatic, but I have had to contact customer service every time.  It's frustrating.  Be prepared to set reminders on your cell phone to follow-up if you take advantage of these offers.

title: After being denied points for a…
body: After being denied points for a completed survey, I contacted for correction. I was asked for a copy of my identification before points would be processed. As I've had to contact customer care countless times due to negligence, errors and false advertisement and my ID had never been asked for previously, this was found to be suspicious. Particularly because I had lodged several complaints with the BBB and The Attorney General. Nonetheless, I did as instructed, but asked twice for an explanation as to why my identification was needed to make certain it was NOT retaliation. Though I received the due points, no explanation for the sudden identification request has been offered. I know many MyPoints members none of which have been asked for their ID. I suppose it is time for another report to the BBB and the Attorney General as the company refuses to act in a legal manner.

title: This site used to be great
body: This site used to be great.  The past few years have all been downhill.  Many things do not work.  Have not been able to submit an Everyday Receipt in months.  Magic Receipts - may take days for something to be reviewed and credited.  Surveys  I see a lot, but some days 5 DQs, some days 4 DQs, way too many delayed points.  Reduction in survey points.  Misleading survey times.  It may say 5 minutes and ends up being 12-20 minutes and if you are not booted out, you are lucky.  I read a lot of comments from others and many are struggling daily to get their meager points.  Some days I may try up to 40 surveys to get one.  Of course, they do not show up in the visited section.  It was great to have videos to pick up those extra points one needs to hit that bump to get your goal  Now they are gone.  I understand printable coupons are going away, but that is not MyPoint's fault.  So many things to write about, just don't want to be banned from here as well.

title: Would be better rating but they just want your personal info
body: Would be better rating but they, along with other survey sites, remove your ability to take surveys after so long. They want your information more than they want to pay for people taking surveys. Many times I took surveys just asking opening questions like DOB or age only to have them say I was being dishonest. I believe I know my age and DOB.

title: Redeeming Points Can Be an Adventure
body: When I attempted to redeem some of my points, I encountered difficulties as My Points seemed to believe my phone number (needed for an additional verification step, after I had successfully entered the password) was that of someone else. (I suppose I shouldn't be surprised -- I keep getting spam phone calls from people wanting to speak to folks who are not present...) The contact system appeared to be set up to handle the most common inquiries with referrals to FAQs, but ill prepared for an unusual problem such as the one I experienced (it may need some improvement, and a contact phone number for My Points Customer Service would have been quite useful). With some effort and difficulty, I was able to contact Customer Service with my post. Though the initial answer was from one of their robots, a human eventually sent an answer and update on the case. It required me to photograph and transmit a picture of my photo ID to Customer Service, which I was able to do after some initial problems (some involved the time I was allotted on the computer at the local library, while others concerned the fact this was my first time in sending such a picture). The matter was then resolved, and I was authorized to redeem my points. My thanks to the My Points Customer Service person who assisted me! One day, I shall doubtless look back on the whole incident as an interesting adventure.

title: There have been several times when I…
body: There have been several times when I completed surveys and did not get credit.  I have to put a ticket too many times to correct the issue.  When I have other issues which I submit a ticket, I always get canned answers that do not address my issue. For example, I printed coupons but never got any credit for them. After writing a ticket, they responded by telling me how to print coupons.  I repeatedly told them that printing was not the problem and that I had no problem printing but I just was was not getting the credit for printing.  I even submitted pictures of the coupons I printed. Again the canned response several times was how to print coupons.  After I requested that the ticket be elevated, I was told they could not help when I asked for a contact at coupons.com and refused to answer any further correspondence.   I managed to figure out the problem myself  but someone at MyPoints or coupons.com or the vender who handles the coupons would have to fix the issue.  And guess what, it has nothing to do with the inability to print.  I would explain here was the problem is but MyPoints really couldn’t not care less and I have since found another way to get credit for coupons.  Addressing specific issues with MyPoints really sucks.

title: Point Perk link wouldn't work -- and I lost five points
body: I tried to add a Point Perk to my Account about 24 minutes before the Perk was due to expire.  It wouldn't allow me to do that.  I tried and tried, and finally gave up.  Then about five minutes to 1 p.m. (when the Perk was supposed to expire), I logged in again.  I found that the link was now working, but again I tried to put the code into the Point Perk area, suddenly it was after 1 p.m. and it said the code had expired again!  I felt that since the link wasn't working for about 20 minutes or more, MyPoints should have extended the time for us to enter the code and get our Point Perk points!

title: Love MyPoints
If you have a lot of spare time
body: If you have a lot of spare time or if you like normally shop at some of their affiliated stores you can end up with gift cards from Visa or various retailers. If you don't shop online much and try to get those same gift cards through various activities or answering surveys, you are in for a lot of effort. They recently changed values on surveys. 45 days ago, a 10-15 minute survey often provided you with 75-100+ points. Now that same survey is probably earning 20-30 points. It takes almost 800 points to earn a $5 gift card. That works out to about 50 cents per hour if you are lucky and qualify for every survey.

title: Discover deal on Bingo board does not shade itself in when completed
body: The Bingo board is very fun and usually it is a weekly thing where you have to opt in.  But, the last four Bingo boards that I completely did, I had to submit for less points because the Discover square would never credit me.  I always did the Discover deal over 100 points on the FIRST day of the bingo board, and seven days later it is still not shaded in.  So , I always have a full board BUT, when I submit it, I cannot submit a full board because the Discover square is still pending. This is very frustrating and dishonest.  They need to remove the Discover square because it is a problem.  I am not the first to complain about this.  I think this is very dishonest and needs to be removed from the board completely. I have belonged to mypoints over 15 years and I love it, but this is the second biggest issue I am having with their Company.  The first is I cannot sign into the Mobile App, it continually says "not authorized" but Apple Phones can sign into that mobile app and I do not have an Iphone and don't want one either.

title: The panel is only creative on how to…
body: I am seeing a lot of fake reviews; despite of users being verified. They have no clue about how the panel works and they don't see how they get screwed. The panel is only creative on how to make more money while keeping the incentives ridiculously low for many surveys, which very often end at 60-70% completion. Days long studies, like beverages diaries, disappear from the ledger/dashboard out of nowhere half completed and unpaid. The videos you watch, can go offline and miss the streak that gets you the points. They haven't fixed that in a decade. You can never check on tickets' status. They have disabled that panel. They only respond to like 10% of your tickets and oftentimes, a month late and only to those requests they don't have to pay anything to begin with. They don't allow pdf format for receipts and the email they give you to send them to verify manually if you have an issue, they never check it. Costco for example, is now storing in-store receipts as a PDF in your online account but the MyPoints system only accepts images. As far as crediting for surveys that you report with a problem, that, never happens. They want you to confirm via email that what you report is correct before they even look at, so they buy time and have a chance to do nothing if you don't reply. I have been a member for over 10 years and my experience is very mixed. I have a feeling that they believe, people are naive and can't figure out what they do to them. They seem to be affiliated with InboxDollars who scammed me out of 75 dollars because a 72-year-old family member who was also a member, took a few surveys during vacation in Europe. Stay away from that panel too. Nasty!

title: Don't deliver points as promised, Customer Service is a joke
body: I have been a member for years. I recently followed a BonusMail offering 25,500 Points to open a new bank account and make a deposit. At first only 8,500 points were awarded. After attempting to call C/S (impossible!) and a few emails, an additional 8,500 points were awarded. When I inquired again about the missing points, they REMOVED the second 8,500 points. So a promised 25,500 points resulted in only 8,500 total points awarded. With no way to talk to a real person, their Customer Service is a joke and they appear to lie about their offerings with no attempt to deliver as promised. I would rate them 0 stars if I could.

title: I've been a member for 20 years!
Surveys are programed for future shut…
body: Surveys are programed for future shut down. For the past few years, it has been a constant, shut down of doing surveys. You get the lovely "Why Surveys are not for me" and I would always submit a ticket asking why. They would send a pre written canned response of they monitor surveys and some of my answers didn't match. At first I thought it was from my cats walking on my keyboard as some of the surveys would auto advance on their own. So I figured it was that. They were nice and would re-activate. This happed so many times, I finally would not let my cats in the room while doing surveys. Then this last time, I got the dreaded..Why surveys are not for me. I could not figure out why as the cats didn't walk on keyboard and I was so careful. So submitted a ticket. Got the canned reply, but the girl re-activated. I went to do a survey, only answered one question. Was I a male or Female. I clicked male and right away got the "Why surveys are not for me" So I still had the ticket email and went back and repied to it saying I only clicked on male and got the Why Surveys are not for me. I got the canned reply from this ticket girl and went back and it allowed me to finish the surveys that day. The next day, it did the same thing. one question and Boom, Why surveys are not for me. That was when the light bulb went off in my head. When they re-activate your surveys, they must click a program that tells the system to kick you out, in a week, month, day, but it is definitely programed in. So either the program has a bug in it or the ticket girl is just clicking 1 day and then deactivate. I sent another reply to the same ticket girl saying I have gotten the message. Meaning I have figured out their lying system. I'm an old man, and they must want younger people who buy things all the time through their site. I don't buy much or buy from non of their merchants. So if your young, and make a lot of purchases, you might be ok to try mypoints. But if you get this Why Surveys are not for me, then you are now on their delete list.

title: fast on redemption
PIN sent took to long to get to my phone, now acct frozen.
body: I joined 11-18-2022, seemed ok, but on the emails they send, a lot wanted to send me a PIN in order to get the points. Ok a lot of PINs sent. Then the other day when clicking on the Daily Goal email, again wanted to send my cell phone a PIN, well, I clicked ok, and nothing sent to my phone for about 10 minutes, So when I went to enter the number, suddenly my account is frozen. So I started a ticket to tell them I think there was a lag in them sending me the PIN number and now it won't let me earn some points through the email and it won't let me redeem my points about 60.00 worth. Then I get a reply email in 10 days saying they want a Government I.D sent in. If they wanted a Passport or DL they need to do that when people sign up. I am not going to send them that info. They try to say it's a secure site, etc gives me 2 days to submit. I am just going to close my account. If they ask me why I'll tell them I think they purposely delayed sending that PIN number to my cell phone, I think they don't want older people doing their website. We don't buy enough. Who knows. I've heard a lot of bad things. I didn't even make it 6 months. and it is not my fault it took 10 minutes for their PIN number to get to my phone. I told them I didn't change my password, address, or cell phone number. I thought it was an internet slowness, but now I know they are crooks who don't want to pay out if you are an older person.

title: I have been a member for several years…
body: I have been a member for several years now.  But in the last 3-4 mths., the MyPoints .com program has gotten way out of hand!  For instance, I purchased a 1 yr. subscription to the Norton Anti Virus program, and was suppose to receive 4,399 bonus points.  It has now been a month and I still don't have my points!  I have filled out the ticket to request my points, but, to no avail!  Also, I have completed multiple surveys and have not been awarded my points...ticket request sent at least 2x per ticket!  Also, I have taken screenshots of each days progress I make with the MyPoints.com program and included them with each ticket, and then I get an e-mail requesting a screen shot of exactly what i am talking about!  It's getting aggravating, disgusting, and irritable!  So, I have typed a 12 page letter, along with pictures of the actions i have taken and the response I get from the MyPoints.com team members and am sending to the BBB in the San Francisco/El Segundo, California area, and asking them to investigate the situation!  Sick of MyPoints.com!!!!!!!!

title: I love Mypoints but it's not without its flaws
body: First off, it's a great program if you need to earn a little extra money for those everyday purchases. I've been with the program now for around 10 years. Surveys are a necessity if you want to earn points in any reasonable amount of time. That being said he can be difficult sometimes to qualify for a survey, and also many times I found technical flaws and errors on surveys that prevent  getting points. Mypoints makes it very difficult to file a trouble ticket. It's a very cumbersome process and even when you finally do get the ticket filed often they will send you back an email asking for information that was already provided on the ticket. In other words it appears that they are making it difficult purposely to discourage submitting tickets. Sadly this is usually successful because trying to leap over the various hurdles isn't worth the effort and usually I just give up and try another survey. On a positive note, Mypoints provides other options to earn small point levels. It's very easy to spend way too much time this way though, so you have to develop a strategy so it doesn't become another day job. If Mypoints would be more customer-focused to help members who experience survey problems it would be a really great program.

title: I HAVE HAD SERIOUS PROBLEMS TRYING TO REDEEM MY GIFT CARDS
body: I have had serious problems trying to redeem my points into gift cards  I have had absolutely no help from the my points help center.  The just of things is tht I have been a member since around 1997.  All this time I have had one email address.  Last month I was notified my provider was closing the email down the first of February.  I didn' want to lose my points so I thought I was changing my enmail address and instead I inadvertantly created a newaccount.  for awhile I was able to log into my old email accountl and redeem some of my points.  I had approx 63,000 points when this all started,  Knowing my email would end the first of February, my plan was to use the points on gift cards by February 1st.  I received a $50.00card from Olive Garden which for some reason I cant load on Google Pay. j jMaybe the code is wrong.  Another gifr card for Olive Garden for $25.00 I never received.  I received a $50.00 card for oUTBACK WHICH i AM LOCKED OUT OF GETTING.  tHE EMAIL i CHANGED TOO WHICH SCREWED EVERYTHING UP WAS . i KNOW NOW THERE ARE CERTAIN PROCEDURES TO GO THROUGH TO CHANGE YOUR EMAIL BUT IT TAKES MUCH DIGGING TO FIND OUT THERE IS A PROCEDURE.  sINCE THE HELP CENTER HASN" TRIED TO HELP ME i WONDER IF YOU COULD.  tHE QUESTION i HAVE IS IF i UNSUBSCRIBE AND WAIT ADAY OR TWO, AND THEN GO THROUGHT THE PROPER CHANNEL i FOUND BY DIGGING IT UP ACCIDENTLY, COULD i GET ACCESS TO THE 30,000 POINTS AND THE THREE GIFT CARDSS DUE ME,  i APOLOGIZE FOR THE SPELLING.  i AM 83 YEARS OLD, AND NEARLY BLIND DUE TO A RARE BLOOD DISEASE.  i HAVE TO TRAVEL 200MILES TO MY DOCTORS AND BACK ON A BI-MONTHLY BASIS FOR TREATMENT AND i HAVE TO USE VERY COSTLY HIGH RISK MEDICATION TO KEEP THE DISEASE UNDER CONTROL.  aNY HELP YOU CAN GIVE WILL BE HIGHLY APPRECIATED.  sINCERELY YOURS, tHOMAS c. bRICKER

title: Kind Of Hard to Get Customer Service Help When You Need It
body: I have been on MyPoints for years.  Until recently I had no real problems using the site or getting customer service.  I guess recently they changed policy on redeeming points and require people to receive a text to verify before submitting for gift cards. For those who don't own a cellphone (I know; go figure in this day and age, but what are you gonna do) that is an impossible task. The next option for verification I was offered was sending in a photo of my ID to verify who I was, which of course, is also not possible unless you have a mobile phone, not to mention MyPoints doesn't need my photo ID since they have never known what I look like since I started using their website.  I had to send several emails explaining this problem to customer service.  Every time I did, I got the same customer service person answering my ticket who would alternate between telling me to send in the photo of my ID to verify, even though I had explained in my ticket that I was unable to do so, and giving me non answers that had nothing whatsoever to do with the problem I was experiencing.  I got this same person again after what was planned to be my last ditch effort to get this resolved before I would be forced to delete my account with MyPoints.  Because, obviously, I was going to be unable to use the site as intended going forward.  I got another non answer, which I answered sarcastically.  After all, I was stuck between a rock and a hard place at this point and didn't expect a whole lot.  After that reply from me, I finally got a different customer service rep who actually resolved the issue.  I think it is a shame that it took me so many months and emails to get a real answer from someone there.  Are there literally only two customer service reps with MyPoints and it's hit or miss whether you get the one who can't answer complaints or the one who knows how to resolve issues?

title: I have been a member of Mypoints for…
body: I have been a member of Mypoints for over 20 years. I encouraged my other family members to participate. 4 years ago in one day My account, my wife's account, my dad's account and my son's account were all deeactivated the same day for no reason. Of course you cannot call Mypoints, you cannot get a response from there terrible customer service, support tickets are a joke.  Gradually my wife was able to restablish an account. Likewise I was able to reestablish an account. My wife is now prohibited from doing surveys and again for no reason and no response from Mypoints. I think Mypoints is a ripoff and would not recommend anyone using it. I have learned just enough from Peanut surveys, videos, and emails to get a $50 gift card every 6-8 weeks. It's not worth it but it is my way of getting a little bit back from Mypoints when they stole over $300 from my family in one day 4 years ago for no reason and will never give me an answer.

title: Technical Issues Addressed
body: A few days ago I had a technical issue while taking a survey. The system repeatedly stalled for long periods of time and was slow to advance as I was taking the survey. This continued throughout the survey making it hard to complete. Finally it came to a point near the end where the screen froze completely. I was able to capture a snippet of this and send to the team for review. They responded immediately and stated they would share this info with the survey creator/owner. I received full credit for the survey and an apology for the technical difficulties faced. Great customer service! Thanks so much.

title: Clicking on most of the emails…
body: Clicking on most of the emails automatically gives you 5 points. Spending a few minutes a week to do surveys, etc. also, more points. You can redeem those points for gift cards for the holidays or a Visa prepaid card which is the same as cash. This year alone I got back $300. Not to mention the deals that are offered. If you're shopping online, make sure you check MyPoints to see if the online store you're looking at is linked, because you can make 1-5 points per dollar. It's worth it!

title: MyPoints was excellent when I first…
body: MyPoints was excellent when I first joined, As the years have gone by, I don't know if it's the fault of MyPoints or the partners, but the opportunity to earn 5 points just for clicking on an e-mail have all but disappeared. I totally get in today's world, everybody wants you to buy something in order to get something in return, but we as consumers (MOST of us anyway) are in the same boat as the "providers" (sellers), Also, the selection of redemptions has dwindled over the years as well, again whose fault it is is unknown. I still will use MyPoints as you do earn points with purchases and I have been able to make a few linked purchases in the past.

title: In For the Long Haul
body: I have used this site for over a year now and can honestly say it's a professionally and politely run site. In the off chance you have a payout order go awry, customer service swiftly addresses it friendly as well as quickly. Where as some sites go downhill making it harder to achieve payouts over time, this one offers you more things such as offers, surveys and game challenges to keep you involved as time passes and you have been a member longer. I've just started receiving  personal mails to join consumer input and group opinion tasks. You get compensated for your time via Remesh for being involved an hour or two of your time. Anything I've done linked to MyPoints, they've always kept their end up payment wise. Looking for something that keeps you feeling involved over time? This is the place.

title: i recommend
body: One amazing thing about this app is that it’s not a scam! You get gift cards, cash sent to your paypal account, Visa prepaid gift cards(Stay away from the visa gift card, the pain in the butt.) One challenging aspect is, it takes so long to earn the points. If you do surveys, you may not be eligible for all the surveys, if you want to sign up bonuses, u end up signing up for a million things. And the stuff that really gives your s bang for your buck, you wouldn’t want to really do more than once. Like open a bank account, or sign up for Amazon services. Nevertheless there a lot of scams out there, and this is not one of them.

title: MyPoints is Great!!
body: I've been using MyPoints to earn gift cards for several years. While there are the occasional glitches, like with any website, I'm usually able to earn at least 1 $25 gift card a year just doing minimal things, such as answering the daily poll, clicking on emails and visiting websites. Lately, some of the sites they want us to sign up with, especially the online banks, are pretty sketchy and I refuse to do it. I also gave up on the surveys as I seldom qualify for them. We can still earn a good amount of points by entering and purchasing at stores we regularly shop at through their site, though. Giving to charities is also an option to earn points.

title: Missing and disappearing points
body: I have been a customer of MyPoints for many years.  I am used to reading many MyPoints emails daily during my leisure time and enjoy the small rewards.  But recently, while reading their email ads to me on 12/9/21-12/10/21, I found accidently that about 500 points are gone from my point balance. I then checked my transaction statement online, there was no clue and no notice at all as why.  Checking more, I found that all my posted points of shopping online via MyPoints, together with the shopping records, were completely erased with no reason and notice.  If I do not remember my past posted information, it is hard to recall these erasing points at all.  It is really shocking and scary, just like your money in your bank account is gone silently without any trace!

title: Earning more with Mypoints
body: Mypoints is excellent I started back up in September over 2 years of joining Mypoints from CashCrate.com which shut down in 2019. I first started out earning more points, in September I started earning 1000 points a day. By October I worked my way up earning 1500 points a day. In November of last month I have earned 2000 points a day. Now I am earning even more earning up to 2500 points a day. So far I have earned in total 169,770 lifetime points in Mypoints. What is my secret is mostly surveys, watching videos, bonuses, and my favorite uploading receipts from name brand retailers. I tell you it Is incredible earning so many points. I am looking forward of earning 250,000 points that I am currently working on. Overall the entire layout looks friendly and there are no problems.

title: Been a member for years
body: Here is the good and the bad.  I have been a member of My Points for years now.  I don't care for any of the newer cash back entities like Honey or Rakuten.  I've been loyal to my points for over 10 years now.  The main reason I joined ironically was to take surveys.  I loved taking online surveys, but I have used them for purchases as well.  However, on two occasions I was suspended from taking surveys for supposedly providing "incorrect or inconsistent" responses.  This most recent time I have been suspended for over a year now.  It's frustrating because if you make one wrong mistake with your birthdate, age, sex, etc in a survey that affects your standing overall.  It's like they expect complete perfection.  And I've belonged to other survey sites for years, made mistakes, because I'm only human, and still am allowed to take them. So I don't make as much now.  I don't earn as many points.  Which is frustrating. and I don't buy as much online anymore as well so I was hoping more free offers would be available. But they've been offering gradually less and less over the years.  IT's definitely going downhill. But I'm not ready to switch over completely to another site.

Previously, there has been a choice and the default was a physical card. Nowhere in the process was it indicated it would be an e-card. I repeated the process again in case I had missed that option and still didn't find it. I specifically wanted a physical card as her birthday is close to Christmas and I try to make it 2 separate events.

body: After reviewing my account, I noticed that points I earned for signing up with one of their offers were nowhere to be found. I sent an email regarding a request to check into the problem and had an email returned quickly. They explained that these missing points were pending and they should show up within 30 days. Just a few days prior to the 30 days I received another email telling me that the points had been added to my account. There they were just in time to redeem them for gift cards for the holidays!! Thanks 😊 for the quick response to my email.

title: Points not awarded as promised costing me $100
body: I took advantage of a MyPoints offer for 160,000 points for a paid one year membership to Walmart+ in December of 2020. The hook was that the points would offset the $100 cost of the membership so it seemed like a no-brainer way to try it out. I contacted MyPoints via their online inquiry form a couple months after the transaction to ask when the points would be credited and was basically told to wait a little longer. I contacted them three more times within a few months of the first inquiry. These inquiries were completely ignored. There is no way to actually speak to person that I could find so you are without any options if they ignore your inquiries. Ten months later the points have not been credited to my account and I’m out the $100 for the Walmart+ service that isn’t that great. I’ve been using MyPoints for a long time but I recently cashed out my points and am done with them. The next step will be a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.

title: I love using MyPoints
body: I love using MyPoints! They're legit and have a lot of activities beside surveys to earn money. Also, they have outstanding technology that tracks all the activities you do. If a task does not credit, you can submit a ticket to their support team, who are glad to help resolve the issue! They're the finest when it comes to getting credit for missed items, and you do not need to worry about them being unfair as long as you completed the activities as requested. They are a pleasure to work with and every redemption I requested for money to PayPal has been smooth with no issues. There are plenty of gift cards to choose from as well if you prefer redeeming that way instead. They have a low minimum redemption at $10 which is marvelous as well, so you don't need to wait long to redeem your points.

title: Great for Casual use or More!
body: I have been using the MyPoints system for somewhere over 10 years or so. I'm a casual user and cash in my point about once a year or so, depending on what I'm looking for. Sometimes it's a coffee card, other times (like this time) it's to help pay for Christmas gifts. I know I can make more out of my earning, but I'm happy as a clam with my casual use and don't feel pressured to increase it at all.

title: They used to be so much better
body: They used to be so much better. Every email they sent was worth 5 points. Now, you're lucky to get one out of all their spam that will give you 5 points. All of them are "Buy this thing and get some points" sprinkled in with some fad programs that their surveys show are mostly ignored. I usually average 6-10 points a day, which means VERY slow going (it took me years just to get enough for a $25 gift card). I signed up for this long ago because I don't have money, and this is still better than nothing, but it's gone so far downhill from where it used to be.

title: My Points is easy to use and points are…

title: Getting my Amazon gift card was super!
body: Getting my Amazon gift card was super easy to get and to use it. I especially liked the fact that I was able to have the link re sent to me after the link expired. I thought I was going to use it but changed my mind at the time twice, and each time I was able to retrieve the link. The gift card appeared on the checkout without me even having to add it on which was very convenient. All and all it was a good experience.

title: Simple and fantastic - MyPoints is the best

You're introduced to different offers and services through a simple email. All you need to do is click, read in some cases. In other cases, you're given a chance to sign up for a service or purchase an item. You're never forced to do anything you're not interested in doing. They simply incentivize doing things that you are interested in. How much better can you get?

body: I find it time consuming. I joined because I thought I could save/earn points and get a reward.  I live in a small rural area.  I am a senior.  Many of the games you play are not relevant and to me, childish.  I feel that this program is geared toward the younger person and someone who lives in a city.  We have 2 grocery stores in this town.  Many of the items you list I do not buy and o not wish to buy and it is difficult to find them in the stores, let alone get any points for them.  I have sent multiple emails that I have never gotten a reply to. I have been denied points because you say the receipt has no date or some other excuse.  It is frustrating and time consuming so I will no longer participate as much as I used to.

title: I’ve been using MyPoints for years.
body: I’ve been using MyPoints for years. These are literally my points. They aren’t used to buy gifts or go pay back favors. When I need a pick-me-up, I check to see how many points I have accrued. Sometimes I get a little something; sometimes I decide it would be better to wait. I usually redeem points to get around $15. It’s great. I decide which of my favorite companies to buy from, redeem the points, get a code to enter and place my order. The full transaction is done within minutes.

title: I think this site is pretty good
body: I think this site is pretty good, for the most part. Earning points can be easy, just take time depending on how much money you spend. Without spending money, you earn points very slowly, but they do add up over time. The more new things you sign up for, and spend money on, the faster you get large sums of points, which you can then exchange for gift cards. My one big complaint is that if you need help with anything, there isn’t really any customer service to speak of. I got locked out of my surveys years ago, and they never did “get back to me” as of why, and to this day they still have not unlocked the survey section for me, which also impedes me earning points.

title: YOU SHOULD HAVE TOLD ME.
body: I've been a mypoints.com member for 21 years. We are going on vacation, and I decided to redeem my points for a Visa card. Due to the way the redemption was structured and the number of points that I had... I had to make two redemptions. One or $100 and the other for $200.  The way the description was listed... it indicated that you could use them anywhere Visa is accepted. I thought I would be getting actual Visa cards... Wrong!  Once I received the email confirmation of my redemption... it was clear that it could be used anywhere ON-LINE -- that Visa is accepted.   In order to get actual plastic cards—I had to agree to pay $5 for each of them.  So – that was them I had $10 I had to forfeit. This should have been put in the description before I redeemed those points!!

title: Unjust Deactivations, Bad Customer Service, Waste of Time, BEWARE
body: I had my points for 3 weeks, at least, and about a week or so ago I received my 50 dollar gift card. I was happy, it was a great site and easy to earn points with. But then yesterday I get on again -and I have over 1000 points on that account- and suddenly my account is deactivated. I finally get hold of them (it was way too much of a hassle and process to get a hold of these people, btw) and I receive an email just a few minutes later from them claiming they further reviewed my account and it will remain closed for not complying with their terms and no further explanation. So, I haven't the slightest clue what I did wrong. They don't tell you anything, just say you broke the terms of service. If they would actually tell me what I allegedly did then maybe I would understand but I know I didn't do anything on that account except do surveys, complete my to-do list, and complete deals. I've read through the terms of service and didn't break a single rule. Ridiculous. So, watch out, you might randomly get deactivated one day. At least I got something out of it-

title: I used MyPoints to trade points for LL Beam Gift Cards
body: I used MyPoints to trade points for gift cards for my brother's birthday. I then used the link offered in the card I received to send the gift card to him.  Although the site indicated the card had been transmitted, he advised he did not in fact receive the card. I was able however to log in to MyPoints account and retrieve the gift cards, send them to myself, then print the cards as a PDF file and send them to him attached to an e-mail, so all worked out well, but I was concerned when he told me he had not received the e-cards directly. Otherwise the transaction was smooth and I was able to redeem points for the gift cards without difficulty.

title: MyPoints needs serious improvement
body: MyPoints needs to seriously consider improving your cash back process. Several times things are not picked up when a receipt is initially submitted. If my initial receipt is rejected, I request a review and then the nightmare begins. I had to send multiple emails and send pictures of the item with my receipt multiple times. The customer service rep kept adding 3 points instead of 3000 points and responded with a generic email instead of actually reading my email. It should not be so difficult to get money back. It almost seems as though you are intentionally making the experience horrible so people will just give up. Please go back to the drawing board with you receipt process. Your computer system needs to pick up more rebates when initially submitted and when under review, the review time needs to be drastically improved because it takes too long. A customer should not have to send photos of the their products and the receipt over and over again only to be disregarded. I think this is the worst rebate program in existence. Sorry but I am just being honest.

title: No Longer Worth It
body: MyPoints has deteriorated over the years. Emails promising quadruple points for printing coupons barely gets one point for each. Further, I can no longer get points for redeeming those coupons at my store, and it's extremely inconvenient to change stores just for a few coupons. Buying items online for X-points-per-dollar disappear without resolution, with no points awarded. Surveys can take ten minutes of time answering questions that are extremely specific (as if getting information for the survey itself) only for the system to tell me that I don't qualify for the study in question. It takes too much time to get very little reward. I was a member for well over a decade, often able to get enough points for two $25 gift cards per year. I'm extremely disappointed to see how far they've fallen.

title: Love almost all of your program!
body: I love your program in almost every way. The only exception is your oversite of the surveys. Several times a month, I completely finish a survey (and told so and thanked) then click to submit it for credit, and am either told that I did not qualify or just returned to MyPoints without even that. These are surveys that I have spent 30-40 minutes on, not ones where I actually did not qualify. I used to report this and usually was recompensed, but that got to be too big a hassle, so now I just go on. Otherwise, your program is 5 stars plus. Just wish you could put a tighter reign on those who get the benefit of their surveys, then don't pay out.

title: Great opportunity to accumulate & redeem points for gift cards!
body: On MyPoints, I do surveys (or try to) as well as a few other easy activities like watch videos or vote in a poll.  You can even upload your receipts for points.  All the points add up.  I usually keep the points in the "bank".  I just redeemed  my accumulated points for gift cards that I will print out and give to volunteers of my local group.  This worked out great as I did not have to spend as much money on my "gifts".  It will take me a little while to accumulate more points but I do it little by little.  Over time it adds up! You just have to find a little  time to go to the website to participate.  It's worth a try.

title: My experience after joining  my points 23 years ago on Dec. 31st 1998
body: I still remember joining my points when I was only 51 years old. I read it from a Sunday magazine about this great site to join with lots of fun, winning surprise gifts and daily surveys and points to do your shopping at so many different places for points. I remember calling my kids to join immediately and my sister and husband, my best friends and neices and nephews. I have used my points in so many different wonderful ways.  It still has been so much fun, a great experience in all these years and I am still as excited now as the first day when I joined. At that time you could talk to employees if there as any kind of problem you could have had. As I end  this little respond I just want to say how grateful I am to this day how much this site has meant so much to me in so many ways and I thank-you so much for it.

title: Huge disappointment
body: I have been disappointed with MyPoints recently because I have spent a lot of time taking surveys only to be let down by not receiving my reward points after successful completion of surveys.  I received the “green” notification stating I successfully completed the survey, but no points awarded to my account.  This seems to be happening more often.  I submitted a request ticket to MyPoints with the picture evidence (3 different pictures of the survey activity) only to be denied my points.  MyPoints said they have no way of confirming the completion.  Today I had the same thing happen with a survey so I submitted a request again.  I get the same generic response and I’m sure they will send me the same generic denial.  This is not good for business nor customer relations.  If you are thinking about joining MyPoints keep in mind that customer support/satisfaction is not high on MyPoints agenda.

title: My Points is the best!

With the My Points site, I can redeem points whenever I like.  The variety of stores from which I can shop is vast and includes most major retailers.  I also like the ability to earn points doing other site-based activities instead of being restricted to getting points for purchases only.  When redeeming points, I can choose from an array of venues for my gift to myself.

title: Unacceptable failure to consistently credit points
body: The program all too frequently fails to properly credit points earned, especially for printing coupons and crediting for coupons used in the store- something I can't recall happening even once. With other failures to credit I sometimes get a cordial response from Customer Service restoring the points, but other times despite through documentation and timely submittable, I am told the request is too late, or  there is no response at all. For example, most recently my credit request for a subscription to Creative Bug (800 points) and a registration and auto insurance quote through Savvy (3000 points), have simply gone unanswered. Sometimes I feel like I should ask United MIleage Plus, the sponsor of MyPoints to do a better job. Hope they will.

title: Awesome rewards, mediocre service.
body: This service has amazing rewards. But their service is definitely lacking. First off, it takes a hot minute for your redeemed gift card to be sent to you… and I find it somewhat frustrating with how many times its randomly kicked me out of Surveys for no apparent reason. And if you have a problem to report they aren’t that quick to help. It takes a while and sometimes they don’t even let you know if they’ve fixed it or not. Sometimes they don’t answer back to you after months! But now for the positive parts, this service is very  rewarding and has many ways for you to be rewarded. From watching, taking part in surveys, magic receipts, and even making a fair amount of points if you spend a certain amount on an online order (mainly for the desktop version) and a lot more! I enjoy this app and they have a plethora of different gift cards for you to be rewarded with! (Walmart, Nike, Amazon, Apple, AMC theaters, Barnes and Noble, Best Buy, did you can even redeem for a Visa E-card!) so there’s lots of variety. This is a good little tool to make some extra money when you need.

title: Hard Sometimes to Get the Point of MyPoints
body: The main reason why my rating isn't higher is that in recent weeks I've noted that it is now considerably harder to meet point goals on MyPoints than in the past.  Once an entry in Magic Receipts, for example, was judged and accepted or rejected almost immediately; now it takes much longer, sometimes over a week.  For another, point values have been greatly decreased, to the point where often the only way to meet a Daily Goal is through surveys (assuming one can get accepted for such in the first place).  I do appreciate MyPoints and what it offers but sometimes the changes have driven me up the wall!

title: I redeemed points for a giftcard
I have been a member since August 1998
body: I have been a member since August 1998. I was happy with the program and have earned many a reward from MyPoints! However, in all honesty, the MyPoints of late, in my opinion, has been introducing multiple different subprograms and there appears to be a "moving of the goal posts" with regards to earning points. Originally, those surveys with an "!" after the survey number, DID NOT earn you the normal 5 points. However lately regular surveys have also not been providing the 5 points for trying. In the passed, you rec'd a set number of points for your monthly searches, now it's a hit or a miss if you earn any bonus search points and I quite confidently will say IF you get those bonus search points, they certainly will not add up to the previous credits for searching. Again, if you haven't been with MyPoints for long, you probably don't notice teh changes as much!

title: Redeeming your points for gift cards is…
body: Redeeming your points for gift cards is an easy process.  But, it would be so much nicer for the customers, if they could still redeem for physical gift cards, instead of the email ones.  Your whole operation's goal has been to make it harder and harder on the customer.  Especially, taking the surveys and getting credit for the ones completed, but never go through for the points.  Also, and this is a big one...it is so very hard to contact and get answers from the My Points customer service.  Everything has changed terribly!  Sometimes they answer, sometimes they don't.  But, most often they answer with a stock reply that does not help at all. And, when you email back, they reply with another stock answer.  There needs to be a customer service phone number, like every other company, where you can speak to a representative or manager.  It is VERY frustrating to keep talking via email, as issues very rarely get resolved.  If you are trying to push people away from your website, you are succeeding.

title: Unsatisfied customer
body: I fulfilled an offer through GoodRx and was promised points within 45 days of meeting criteria. The points never arrived. On day 46 I submitted a ticket with documents including welcome email from GoodRx, proof of purchase email from GoodRx, and a MyPoints screenshot showing my visit from GoodRx is in pending mode. I received a response telling me that there was no successful completion in their system and therefore cannot issue points. This is not the first time I have had to hound MyPoints for credits. You have to monitor them like a hawk and then hope that they pay out! If the third party refuses to acknowledge the transaction, then MyPoints needs to take appropriate action to accommodate their members, because Bait & Switch is a serious crime!

title: Great company!
The concept is good but they weasel out of giving up points
body: The concept is good but lately, especially over the last year or two, it has become increasingly more difficult to get points. I got booted from surveys with no warning because they did not like my responses??? I thought my responses were anonymous anyway, therefor they should not even know what my answers were. There are frequent errors with the "Bingo" squares not working. Coupon prints only get credited once in a while. I send photos of over a hundred printed coupons I spread out on the floor, still did not get credit. Their receipt upload feature fails 75% of the time and they tell you to click a link to submit for review... Most of the time there is no link to click for review. The last time I sent one for review it was absolutely clear I bought the product in there points selection list. They said they were unable to verify... I bought FOUR Yoplait yogurts, only one was required. I waited 2 weeks to find out I did not get the points credited... NINE points...WOW they weaseled out of that. I figured out I spent over 1 1/2 hours per day to get points worth a $10 gift card in a month. That's Twenty Two Cents per hour...Terrible

title: Redeemed Gift Cards after Much Difficulty
body: I redeemed enough points to get 3 gift cards at Amazon. I was happy to get the cards, but MyPoints would only allow me to redeem 2 per day.  I waited until the next day to get the 3rd card so I could purchase a locking mailbox and mounting post. When I tried to deposit the 3 cards at Amazon - $100, $50, $25, the $50 card was not accepted.  I could not find a good Customer Support phone number to call MyPoints directly. Amazon even tried to contact them for me. I couldn't get immediate help online because the card was too recent. I finally tried several email addresses to them and one did get through for help. Waren at MyPoints wrote me back that he had reactivated my card and Amazon had written me back how to deposit it. Everything finally worked out but it was too late to apply the $50 on my purchase so Amazon gave me a credit for my next purchase. MyPoints needs to setup an easy way to get immediate help when customers run into a problem. I couldn't even submit a request because they asked me to attach a screenshot and wouldn't go on without it.  Fix your website for Customer Support!

title: There Are Good Things and Bad Things
body: The good news is the rewards aren't bad. There can be some very good rebates in the "Magic Receipts" section. But there is bad news. More than once I have submitted a receipt for a rebate only to be told they can't find a qualifying purchase. After that, the rebate disappears from the list. To me, that's fraud. If the rebate is there when I submit it should be honored, period.  The surveys are a pain in the neck. Sometimes you will spend a good amount of time just to be told you don't qualify. Many times, the survey takes so long I figure I made less than a dollar an hour. If you are going to do a survey honestly and give the questions sincere consideration, there is no future in doing them in my opinion unless you have nothing better to do with your time.

title: not much value used to be better
have good gift cards
Pretty Good Shopping Affiliate Program
body: MyPoints is a pretty good shopping affiliate program. I have been a member for nearly 20 years now. You earn rewards points for doing things like clicking through emails and shopping online, and occasionally in store through barcodes scanned at the register. In the first few years, you could earn rewards fairly quickly with very little effort, just click through all the emails and occasionally by something. Within a few months, you could redeem points for a $50 gift card. But a few years in the changed the exchange rate of points from 100 points per dollar, until ultimately it became 158 points per dollar. It's still a good program, but there are very few click thru emails that generate points any more, so unless you buy something, you'll be years earning enough for gift cards. The best way to earn is to find places you shop at and make sure you click thru from the MyPoints page to that storefront to earn points.

title: My Points is always challenging me to…
body: My Points is always challenging me to meet the daily goal of earning 100 points a day and the monthly bonus is great. If I spend enough time per day, I am guaranteed to cash out a few times per month. The surveys themselves are also always cool and interesting.

title: Have yet to receive the gift card!!
body: I’ve been asked to write a review for a site I’ve been a member of since 1998 - not too long after it began. Up until this past year I was quite satisfied with MyPoints. This review request congratulated me on my receiving a gift card I redeemed bonus points for. I have yet to receive that card and I’ve not received quite a few points for shopping experiences even though I used ‘Score’. Sometimes having to click on the icon multiple times, and then write to the MyPoints staff with questions. I’ve gotten excuses about timing, but in the past year even waiting the prescribed time has not seen results in all cases. It has been disappointing to say the least. All the games have taken over.

title: This is a good website for doing surveys
It's hard to overly criticize a system…
body: It's hard to overly criticize a system that pays rewards but even though mypoints is better than some it still has problems: 1. I don't fully know the criteria u use but some other users are dismayed when they are disqualified from doing surveys. Without that service it is hard to meet daily quotas you set. I understand that survey companies want good answers but my experience is that leading, biased & poorly constructed questions, plus not allowing for all reasonable answers invite conscious survey-takers to have to choose the least bad answer. If that provides inconsistent answers it's the survey company's fault but i understand you have to 'go' with them. I get it but it sucks... they are paying you for this. 2. occasionally coupons won't accept my tel# for verification. It sometimes takes weeks to fix this.You never help & coupons.com takes a long time to get their good CSRs working on it. From the suggestions I get in your replies, it's apparent, the responder never read my message beyond the subject line. 3. inconsistent video playback often causes the stream to hang (red banner)at the end but it's not consistent. In particular 'the wobble' and 'crackle' & occasionally 'telemundo' all hang up frequently at the end of the video & require different actions to get to the next. one.  Often while I'm trying to restart it, you send a message criticizing me for going too fast that takes add'l action to get past. 4. magic coupons frequently cant approve an item on uploaded receipts. for example: 'bulk oranges' not recognized as 'oranges', 'italian loaf' not recognized as 'bread', 'ragu' not recognized as 'pasta sauce'. every time i've asked for review, its been approved but sometimes i need the points that day to meet my quota you've established & I have to work harder & use other resources to meet the quota.  you need to make the coupon recognition software smarter. Now, its really dumb. 5. Sometimes it takes 3-5 days to get credit for printing coupons. I try to stagger the crediting to help with meeting the daily quota. When you delay crediting the points for so long & then everything gets credited the same day, it's hard to meet the quota & wastes the points I've accumulated by other means. I use a lot of coupons but I can't possibly use all the coupons offered so i have to try to space out the useful ones because of the daily quota. 6.Too often you change how things work which irritates us.  You've changed the format/layout/operation of 'Magic Receipts' 3 or 4 times in the short time it's been available.  It started out simple; now it's complicated. a couple new features are nice but please Don't fix what's not broken & leave the format as it is.  We don't want to have to learn new ways to do the same old stuff every couple weeks. 7. If you've disqualified a user from surveys yoy still invite them to use features that require surveys to complete.  do you know how irritating that is when you're sure you tried the very best you can to answer the surveys right but got disqualified because the survey companies wrote poor questions, provided a poor selection of answers or didn't like our religious or political view or your age? I understand it's their system & that they call the shots but you don't have to keep inviting us to features we can't do because you prevent us from completing the tasks.

title: MyPoints Member Since September 2002
body: I have been a member with MyPoints since September 2002. Whenever there were any concerns, MyPoints have been very helpful. I praise the staff for all their hard work in keeping members informed with new developments (i.e., posting videos of events on Facebook). I especially appreciate the ingenuity of different "games" and/or projects to keep members interested every week (i.e., Collector's Bill, Rewarding Moments, Point Perks). There use to be a periodic game to search for an image on certain MyPoints merchant websites (i.e., lazy ladybug). There is always something new on MyPoints, like updates and changes on the website that takes a moment to adapt. Other than that, MyPoints is a fun website offering many ways on how to earn points that can be used for gift cards, or even cash. Thank you so much MyPoints and many, many more years of prosperity for your staff and company!

body: When you shut down the support panel for months every year while requests are piling up, you can't be asking for good reviews. You also can't when you shut down the surveys dashboard because one of your stupid clients trapped a participant into providing a SINGLE invalid response to a question OUTSIDE the survey. This panel needs to stop whining about crediting someone claiming they have no control over the surveys. In that case, they need to ask clients to create their own sites to host their surveys to take surveys directly. If you can't play the role of legit aggregator and hold yourselves accountable for anything that happens, you should drop the service. No one gives a crap who's fault is that a survey is broken and/or didn't pay even though completed. YOU pay!. 'Watch Videos' task the biggest fraud existed. Never completes for credit, not to mention the lame incentive. They want you to buy junk food to participate in activities that offer incentives.

body: I like the many options to earn points that I can redeem for gift cards.  It does seem like there are often glitches in point-earning opportunities, and sometimes I don't know when points will be earned. (As an example, it seems that Magic Receipts almost always need to be reviewed; the points can be credited the same day, three days later, a week later, or not at all till I contact Support.  This makes it difficult when you're trying to make sure you achieve the Daily Goal.) The Customer Support team is good, but it doesn't seem like I should be needing to contact them so often.  I'm not thrilled with recent changes to the Home page, or that I'm not receiving points for printing coupons anymore.

title: Used to be a 5 star program, but now...
body: Prior to my recent experiences MyPoints would have gotten 5 stars from me.  It's great if all you want to do is click on the emails and receive your 5 points for each email read. The issue is if you actually sign up for an offer.  Not once, but TWICE this past month I have redeemed hefty orders with promises of receiving points that have still not appeared in my pending points.  For the first one, I was told to wait 2 months and then ask, the second one - customer service hasn't even acknowledged.  I wouldn't have signed up for these offers if not for the promise of the points I should be receiving, and I'm close to deleting my account with MyPoints altogether, which is a shame, since I've been a member for quite a long time.

body: I was working on the MyPoints TO-DO-LIST & completed the DEAL OF THE DAY activity properly on May 25. I was not credited the 600 points & contacted MyPoints & received an automated Ticket reply. I sent an email on June 7, June 24, & July 16 & finally received a new ticket but when MyPoints finally replied, it was with an automated reply regarding Surveys, Offers, or shopping which does not apply to my original ticket request from May 25. Why should anyone continue shopping through MyPoints, or completeing surveys, or offers when MyPoints isn't going to honor your completing it correctly & not even actually reading what is stated when contacting MyPoints.
